DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post Treatment Total Prostate-Specific Antigen Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date of the post treatment total prostate-specific antigen (tPSA) occurred.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post Treatment Total Prostate-Specific Antigen Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the procedure that involves testing prostate-specific antigen after an action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredName: Post Therapeutic Procedure Total PSA Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
